posts.text:
5g home internet is a learning curve.  It's fine tuning a receiver - takes time. 

We kept our ATT fiber ~2mo in overlap until we felt we had the 5g dialed in & reliably.

We also did a couple returns on 3rd party equipment until we dialed-in the right stuff.

T-Mobile app screenshots
posts.author: teej-m.bsky.social

posts.text: The hurdle we ran into with 5g home internet was upload speed & latency.  These two are critical if you're hosting zoom type calls.  The Waveform website has good tutorials to learn about these things if that's an issue for you.
posts.author: teej-m.bsky.social

posts.text: The 5g home internet is a bit of a learning curve but I found this guy's You Tube page pretty good (not this particular vid).  He test trial's new gear and usually has a discount code for 3rd party stuff like the Wave Form Antenna.

posts.text: The tmobile store is half hour away from me and I'm disabled and sick. This is absolutely insane. And of course an extra $40 on top of the monthly pmt to turn service back on. TWO FUCKING DAYS! I've been with sprint for 20 years, and they were great until tmobile took over. FUCK TMOBILE.
posts.author: sarajanemaki.bsky.social

posts.text: Holy fucking shit. Wtf is going on with tmobile?  They literally suspended my account because it's TWO FUCKING DAYS since the due date. This has never happened before. And when I called tmobile they said it's an extra $10 just to talk to someone! Or I have to go to the tmobile store!

posts.text: I've been dealing with no mobile data for 3 months. I've called #TMobile support I think 4 times; just now for 2 hours. Shouted a bit.
